title: Graphium tamerlana
text:
Graphium tamerlana is a butterfly found in <a href="China">China</a> that belongs to the <a href="Swallowtail%20butterfly">swallowtail</a> family.
Description.
It is similar to "<a href="Iphiclides%20podalirius">Iphiclides podalirius</a>". The black band at the apex of the cell of the forewing reaches only to the median vein, not extending beyond it to the hind angle, being exactly as in "<a href="Graphium%20alebion">Graphium alebion</a>", but in contradistinction to this insect, the orange anal spot on the hindwing of is reduced to two small obscure dots.
Etymology.
It was named to honour the Turkic ruler <a href="Tamerlane">Tamerlane</a>.
